se","ingest","inhabit","inhale","inherit","initiate","inject","injure","inlay","innovate","input","inquire","inscribe","insert","inspect","inspire","install","insult","insure","integrate","introduce","invent","invite","join","jump","justify","keep","kick","kid","kill","kiss","kneel","knit","knock","know","lade","land","last","latch","laugh","lay","lead","leak","lean","leap","learn","leave","leer","lend","let","lick","lie","lie","lift","light","like","limp","listen","live","look","lose","love","magnify","maintain","make","manage","march","mark","marry","mash","match","matter","mean","measure","meet","melt","merge","mew","migrate","milk","mind","mislead","miss","mistake","misuse","mix","moan","modify","moo","motivate","mould","moult","move","mow","multiply","murmur","nail","nap","need","neglect","nip","nod","note","notice","notify","nourish","nurse","obey","oblige","observe","obstruct","obtain","occupy","occur","offer","offset","omit","ooze","open","operate","opine","oppress","opt","optimize","order","organize","originate","output","overflow","overtake","owe","own","pacify","paint","pardon","part","partake","participate","pass","paste","pat","patch","pause","pay","peep","perish","permit","persuade","phone","place","plan","play","plead","please","plod","plot","pluck","ply","point","polish","pollute","ponder","pour","pout","practise","praise","pray","preach","prefer","prepare","prescribe","present","preserve","preset","preside","press","pretend","prevent","print","proceed","produce","progress","prohibit","promise","propose","prosecute","protect","prove","provide","pull","punish","purify","push","put","qualify","quarrel","question","quit","race","rain","rattle","reach","read","realize","rebuild","recall","recast","receive","recite","recognize","recollect","recur","redo","reduce","refer","reflect","refuse","regard","regret","relate","relax","rely","remain","remake","remove","rend","renew","renounce","repair","repeat","replace","reply","report","request","resell","resemble","reset","resist","resolve","respect","rest","restrain","retain","retch","retire","return","reuse","review","rewind","rid","ride","ring","rise","roar","rob","roll","rot","rub","rule","run","rush","sabotage","sack","sacrifice","sadden","saddle","sag","sail","sally","salute","salvage","salve","sample","sanctify","sanction","sap","saponify","sash","sashay","sass","sate","satiate","satirise","satisfy","saturate","saunter","save","savor","savvy","saw","say","scab","scabble","scald","scale","scam","scan","scant","scar","scare","scarify","scarp","scat","scatter","scold","scorch","scowl","scrawl","scream","screw","scrub","search","seat","secure","see","seek","seem","seize","select","sell","send","sentence","separate","set","sever","sew","shake","shape","share","shatter","shave","shear","shed","shine","shirk","shit","shiver","shock","shoe","shoot","shorten","shout","show","shrink","shun","shut","sight","signal","signify","sing","sink","sip","sit","ski","skid","slam","slay","sleep","slide","slim","sling","slink","slip","slit","smash","smell","smile","smite","smooth","smother","snap","snatch","sneak","sneeze","sniff","soar","sob","solicit","solve","soothe","sort","sow","sparkle","speak","speed","spell","spend","spill","spin","spit","split","spoil","spray","spread","spring","sprout","squeeze","stand","stare","start","state","stay","steal","steep","stem","step","sterilize","stick","stimulate","sting","stink","stir","stitch","stoop","stop","store","strain","stray","stress","stretch","strew","stride","strike","string","strive","study","submit","subscribe","subtract","succeed","suck","suffer","suggest","summon","supply","support","suppose","surge","surmise","surpass","surround","survey","survive","swallow","sway","swear","sweat","sweep","swell","swim","swing","swot","take","talk","tap","taste","tax","teach","tear","tee","tell","tempt","tend","terminate","terrify","test","thank","think","thrive","throw","thrust","thump","tie","tire","toss","touch","train","trample","transfer","transform","translate","trap","travel","tread","treasure","treat","tree","tremble","triumph","trust","try","turn","type","typeset","understand","undo","uproot","upset","urge","use","utter","value","vanish","vary","verify","vex","vie","view","violate","vomit","wake","walk","wander","want","warn","waste","watch","water","wave","wax","waylay","wear","weave","wed","weep","weigh","welcome","wend","wet","whip","whisper","win","wind","wish","withdraw","work","worry","worship","wring","write","yawn","yell","yield","zinc","zoom","save","rescue","destroy","find a lost","get rid of","get away from","escape from","go to","return to","solve a mystery about","defame","restore the name of","stop","sell","buy","get","hire","fire","have sex with","have a relationship with","fight with","repair","heal","miss","regain trust of","backstab","spy on","take photo of","write something about","communicate with","take a message to","take a message from","deliver some package to","deliver a package from","fight","duel","join power with")>> a <<print either("person","thing","organization","place","event","machine","document","information","parent","sibling","offspring","spouse","love interest","would be love interest","distant relative","parent in law","sibling in law","friend","collegue","comrade","offspring in law","enemy","animal","king/queen","prince/princess","elected official","hired/selected official","CEO","Admin","White collar worker","Blue collar worker","Lower class worker","Creative worker","Scholar, wizard, scribe, researcher","political person","rebel","fighter","love interest","parent","step parent","sibling","in law","son","daughter")>> !!motivation !!<<print either("survival","basic","physical","psychological","spiritual","insanity")>> Survival:Something threatens the life of the entity in question, and escaping the danger is the motivation Basic: Something that is necessary for life sustainance is to be met. Meeting that necessity is basic motivation: Food, Drink, Warmth, Oxygen, Power(mecha), Blood(vampire), Medicine(life saving medicine dependent patient) Physical(Something that is seeked on the physcal scale for the continuation and betterment of life but is not essential for the bare survival) money, sex, greed, entertainment, profit Psychological: Something that is psychological like esteem, proving onse worth, honor etc Spiritual: Finding deeper meaning, purpose Insanity: Quirked cause and effect and logic, includes antisurvival and such without definite cause etc. !!The motivation is for/towards <<print either("self","other single person","other single person : enemy","multiple person","a race","a species","family","own kind")>> <<button "refresh">><<set $refresh=1>><<script>>state.display(state.active.title, null, "back")<</script>><</button>>Need to create a console which I can use to check stuff and use variables READ ABOUT THE 3 ACTS !!ACT 1:<<nobr>> <<linkreplace "Opening Image">>Opening Image – A visual that represents the struggle & tone of the story. A snapshot of the main character’s problem, before the adventure begins.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Set-up">>"Set-up" – Expand on the “before” snapshot. Present the main character’s world as it is, and what is missing in their life.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Theme Stated">>"Theme Stated" (happens during the Set-up) – What your story is about; the message, the truth. Usually, it is spoken to the main character or in their presence, but they don’t understand the truth…not until they have some personal experience and context to support it.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Catalyst">>"Catalyst" – The moment where life as it is changes. It is the telegram, the act of catching your loved-one cheating, allowing a monster onboard the ship, meeting the true love of your life, etc. The “before” world is no more, change is underway.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Debate">>"Debate" – But change is scary and for a moment, or a brief number of moments, the main character doubts the journey they must take. Can I face this challenge? Do I have what it takes? Should I go at all? It is the last chance for the hero to chicken out.<</linkreplace>> <</nobr>> !!ACT 2 <<nobr>> <<linkreplace "Break Into Two (Choosing Act Two)">>"Break Into Two (Choosing Act Two)" – The main character makes a choice and the journey begins. We leave the “Thesis” world and enter the upside-down, opposite world of Act Two.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "B Story/subplot">> "B Story" – This is when there’s a discussion about the Theme – the nugget of truth. Usually, this discussion is between the main character and the love interest. So, the B Story is usually called the “love story”. This can also be the subplot etc.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "The Promise of the Premise">>"The Promise of the Premise" – This is when Craig Thompson’s relationship with Raina blooms, when Indiana Jones tries to beat the Nazis to the Lost Ark, when the detective finds the most clues and dodges the most bullets. This is when the main character explores the new world and the audience is entertained by the premise they have been promised.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Midpoint">>"Midpoint" – Dependent upon the story, this moment is when everything is “great” or everything is “awful”. The main character either gets everything they think they want (“great”) or doesn’t get what they think they want at all (“awful”). But not everything we think we want is what we actually need in the end.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Flase Defeat/False Victory">>"Flase Defeat/False Victory"<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Bad Guys Close In">>"Bad Guys Close In" – Doubt, jealousy, fear, foes both physical and emotional regroup to defeat the main character’s goal, and the main character’s “great”/“awful” situation disintegrates.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "All is Lost">> "All is Lost"– The opposite moment from the Midpoint: “awful”/“great”. The moment that the main character realizes they’ve lost everything they gained, or everything they now have has no meaning. The initial goal now looks even more impossible than before. And here, something or someone dies. It can be physical or emotional, but the death of something old makes way for something new to be born.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Dark Night of the Soul">> "Dark Night of the Soul"– The main character hits bottom, and wallows in hopelessness. The Why hast thou forsaken me, Lord? moment. Mourning the loss of what has “died” – the dream, the goal, the mentor character, the love of your life, etc. But, you must fall completely before you can pick yourself back up and try again.<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Break Into Three">> "Break Into Three"(Choosing Act Three) – Thanks to a fresh idea, new inspiration, or last-minute Thematic advice from the B Story (usually the love interest), the main character chooses to try again.<</linkreplace>> <</nobr>> !!ACT 3 <<nobr>> <<linkreplace "Finale">> – This time around, the main character incorporates the Theme – the nugget of truth that now makes sense to them – into their fight for the goal because they have experience from the A Story and context from the B Story. Act Three is about Synthesis!<</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "Final Image">>"Final Image" – opposite of Opening Image, proving, visually, that a change has occurred within the character.<</linkreplace>><</nobr>> <<button "whathappens1">> <<replace "#whathappens1">> <<print either("Finale","Final Image","Break Into Three","Dark Night of the Soul","Happy flight of soul in cloud 9","All is Lost","All is won","Bad Guys Close In","Flase Defeat","False Victory","Midpoint all is good","Midpoint all is awful","The Promise of the Premise","B Story/subplot","Break Into Two (Choosing Act Two)","Debate","Catalyst","Theme Stated","Opening Image")>> WHAT: <<print either("an image","theme state","talk","some action","fun and games about the story theme","promise of the premise","backstory","false? victory","false?defeat","subplot","catalyst","emotion","theme stated","consequences of previous actions","stay","goto","attempt to maintain status quo","work")>> IF Talk <<print either("dialogue between two of unequal power","dialogue between equals","monologue about self","monologue about something else","talk to multiple person who are superior","talk to multiple person who are equal","talk to multiple person who are inferior","multiple person talking to")>> IF EMOTION <<print either("romance","anger","fear","terror","horror","shock","surprise","desire","greed","insanity","family and relatives","happiness","affection","hate","parent child affection","disgust","friendship","comradeship","cynical","sadness","enlightenment","selfishness","selflessness","feeling")>> WHAT QUALIFIERS:<<print either("positive","negative")>>, <<print either("yes","no")>>, <<print either("true","false")>>, <<print either("life","death")>>, <<print either("right","wrong","unknown right or wrong")>>, <<print either("superior","inferior")>> <<print either("pleasant","unpleasant")>> <</replace>> <</button>> <div id="whathappens1"></div> <<button "refresh">><<set $refresh=1>><<script>>state.display(state.active.title, null, "back")<</script>><</button>> <<print either("Abattoir worker","Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander health worker","Accountant general","Accounts <<elseif $medievalprofession eq "Service Industry-Parisin 1292">> <<print either("maidservant","Barber-Chirurgeon","restaurateur","water carrier","laundress","porter","doctor","bather either("accomptant","accoucheur","accoucheus","accountant","actuary","attendent","bagger","bailiff","Barber-Chirurgeon","barrister","Bartender","bath attendent","bather (profession)","Bodyguard","bodyservant","butler","Camp Cook","Camp Follower","carman","carter","cartier","carver","ceiler","cellarer","chamberlain","chimney maid","seneschal","Serf","Servant","Sin-Eater","Smelter","solicitor","sperviter","Stablehand","Stabler","stainer","Steward","stillroom","surgeon","tapster","teamster","toad doctor","treadmill worker","trencherman","userer","valet","wagoner","waller","water carrier","wattler","weeper","wetnurse","Whipping Boy")>> <<elseif $medievalprofession eq "Unemployed">> <<print either("beggar","buffoon","housewife","pilgrim","transient","squatter","urchin","vagabond")>> <<endif>> <</replace>><</button>> <div id="medievalprofession1"></div><<print either( "1. Augmented Reality Architects - Much like the paint we put on houses and the flavorings we add to food, the future will seem boring if our reality hasn't been augmented in some way.","2. Alternative Currency Bankers - According to Javelin Strategies, 20% of all online trades are already being done with alternative currencies. The stage is being set for next-gen alt-currency banks.","3. Seed Capitalists - In the startup business world there is a huge gulf between initial concept and fundable prototypes. This dearth of funding options will require an entirely new profession. Seed capitalists will specialize in high-risk startups. Counter to todays investment-world thinking, if they get more than 100% return on their investments, they will be docked for not taking enough risk.","4. Global System Architects - Our systems are transitioning from national systems into global systems. Architects of these new global systems will play a crucial role in future global politics. More details here.","5. Locationists - People who specialize in adding the relevance of place to our global online communities.","6. Waste Data Managers - To insure data integrity in today's fast evolving information storage industry, multiple redundancies have been built into the system. Achieving more streamline data storage in the future will require de-duplication specialists who can rid our data centers of needless copies and frivolous clutter.","7. Urban Agriculturalists - Why ship food all the way around the world when it can be grown next door. Next generation produce-growing operations will be located underground, often below the grocery stores where the produce will be sold directly to customers. More details here.","8. Business Colony Managers - The average person that turns 30 years old in the U.S. today has worked 11 different jobs. In just 10 years, the average person who turns 30 will have worked 200-300 different projects. Business colonies are an evolving new kind of organizational structure designed around matching talent with pending work projects. The operation will revolve around some combination of resident people based in a physical facility and a non-resident virtual workforce, with some opting to forgo the cost of the physical facility entirely. People who can effectively manage this type of operation will be in high demand. More details here.","9. Competition Producers - One of the hottest new trends will be to design incentive-based competitions to solve some of the world's biggest problems. Paving the way has been X-Prize Foundation's Pete Diamandis and the success of the Ansari X-Prize. In the future, every major corporation will have their name on a major prize competition. Similar to buying the naming rights to a stadium, a well-orchestrated competition has far-reaching branding potential.","10. Avatar Designers - Next generation avatars will become indistinguishable from humans on a two-dimensional screen. However, avatars will only live in the computer world for a short time longer. It is only a matter of time before they emerge from the computer and appear as visual beings, walking around among us. Once an avatar goes through the radical metamorphosis from an image that we see on a screen to a three dimensional being that joins us for dinner, carries on conversations with our friends, and serves as a stand-in for us at meetings, we will see work start on an even more realistic avatar, one that we can touch. More details here.","11. Avatar Relationship Managers - As the foibles of humanity enter the realm of autonomous, freethinking avatars, people will find it necessary to both manage and limit the often dangerous relationships that avatars get themselves into.","12. 3D Printing Engineers - Classes in 3D printing are already being introduced into high schools and the demand for printer-produced products will skyrocket. The trend will be for these worker-less workshops to enter virtually every field of manufacturing, stemming the tide of outsourcing, at the same time, driving the need for competent technicians and engineers to design and maintain the next wave of this technology.","13. 3D Food-Printer Engineers - Pushing the envelope for 3D printer technology even further, will be the coming age of food printers. Converting 3D printers to work with cartridges containing food-stocks will prove difficult and demanding on a number of levels. Those who can solve this kind of problem will be in high demand. More details here.","14. Book-to-App Converters - Over the coming months we will begin to see a form of competition brewing between books and apps. With both being information products that we interface with differently, we will begin to see a large scale effort to convert existing books and literature into an interactive app, similar to the current effort to convert popular literature from print to audiobooks. More details here.","15. Social Education Specialists - We learn from each other. But what is it that we learn from others that is valuable? And how do we structure a circle of friends, as a highly influential group that we rely heavily on, to give us a constant stream of truly valuable information and advice.","16. Privacy Managers - If you think you have lost most of your privacy already, we've only scratched the surface. We are all terminally human, and as such, we do not always make good decisions. Striking the perfect privacy-transparency balance will require far more than amateur insights. It will require a privacy professional. More details here.","17. Wind Turbine Repair Techs - The proliferation of windmills around the world will dramatically drive the demand for repair techs who are not afraid of heights and can solve whatever new problems this fledgling new industry blows their way.","18. Data Hostage Specialists - Holding people as hostages is very messy. But holding data hostage is a less-risky crime that can be done remotely, and has the potential for far greater rewards. This is especially true if the country you're living in condones your actions. This type of activity will give rise to the likes of data-hostage negotiators, data-retrieval specialists, and damage-control analysts.","19. Smart Dust Programmers - In it's simplest form, smart dust consists of a sensor combined with a wireless transmitter and some kind of power source. Many are envisioning the power to come from wireless RF signals. The reason it is referred to as smart dust is because the technology is shrinking in size until it reaches the particle size of dust. Future designs for smart dust involve detecting everything from moisture content, to soil temperature, to chemical composition. More details here.","20. Personality Services - Talking back and forth to a computer that has a machine-like voice is boring. But being able to download specific personality packages will add an entirely new level of engagement for basement-dwellers everywhere. The hottest personalities to download will be offshoots of existing characters or celebrities such as being able to download a David Letterman personality, a Homer Simpson personality, or perhaps even a Darth Vader personality.","21. Smart Contact Developers - The idea of smart contact lenses, the kind that can superimpose information on the wearer's field of view has been around for a while. But the first iteration of smart contact lenses is already on the market and industry execs are beginning to generate a wide array of possible applications. More details here.","22. Nano-Medics - The medical problems most people have can be traced to a single cell or a small group of them. Health professionals capable of working on the nano-level, both in designing diagnostics systems, remedies, and monitoring solutions will be in high demand.","23. New Science Philosopher-Ethicists - Every new technology creates its own set of unintended consequences, and people who can ask the tough questions and demand deeper introspection will be in high demand. Industry sages will serve as both a conscience and a guide for decision-makers everywhere.","24. Organ Agents - The demand for transplantable organs is exploding and people who can track down and deliver healthy organs will be in hot demand.","25. Octogenarian Service Providers - As the population continues the age we will have record numbers of people living into their 80s, 90s, and 100s. This mushrooming group of active oldsters will provide a demand for goods and services currently not being addressed in today's marketplace.","26. Elevated Tube Transport Engineers - The next big infrastructure project on planet earth will be a human and cargo transport system designed around a network of vacuum tubes with maglev tracks. Operating at less than 2% of the cost of today's car, truck, jet, ship, and train systems, this emerging tube transport system will be a massive undertaking that demands talented new-age thinkers for decades to come. More details here.","The Dismantlers: Over the coming years will see a number of industries dismantled requiring a skilled workforce of talented people who can perform this task in the least disruptive way. Most of these industries have been built around aging facilities and infrastructure that will become unnecessary and unsustainable in the future. These will include:","27. Prison System Dismantlers - More details here.","28. Hospital and Healthcare Dismantlers - More details here.","29. Income Tax System Dismantlers - More details here and here.","30. Government Agency Dismantlers - More details here.","31. Education System Dismantlers - More details here and here and here.","32. College and University Dismantlers - More details here and here and here.","33. Drone Dispatchers - Drones will be used to deliver groceries and pizzas, deliver water, remove trash and sewage, monitor traffic and pollution, and change out the batteries on our homes. Skilled dispatchers for future drones will be high demand. More details here.","34. Brain Quants - Where the stock market manipulators of the past meet the brain manipulators of the future to usurp control of Madison Avenue.","35. Tree-Jackers - Plant and tree alteration specialists, who manipulate growth patterns, create grow-to-fit wood products, color-changing leaves, and personalized fruit. More details here.","36. Plant Psychologists - An entire profession dedicated to undo the damage caused by the Tree-Jackers","37. Extinction Revivalists - People who revive extinct animals.","38. Robotic Earthworm Drivers - The most valuable land on the planet will soon be the landfills because that is where we have buried our most valuable natural resources. In the future, robotic earthworms will be used to silently mine the landfills and replace whatever is extracted with high-grade soil.","39. Gravity Pullers - The first wave of people to unlock the code for influencing gravity.","40. Time Hackers - If we think cyber terrorists are a pain, it will seem like nothing compared to devious jerry-riggers who start manipulating the time fabric of our lives.","41. Clone Ranchers - Raising blank humans will be similar in many respects to cattle ranching. But once a clone is selected, and the personality download is complete, the former clone will instantly be elevated to human status.","42. Body Part & Limb Makers - The Organ Agents listed above will quickly find themselves out of work as soon as we figure out how to efficiently grow and mass produce our own organs from scratch.","43. Memory Augmentation Therapists - Entertainment is all about the great memories it creates. Creating a better grade of memories can dramatically change who we are and pave the way for an entirely new class of humans.","44. Time Brokers - Time Bank Traders - Where do you go when you run out of time? Naturally, to the time-bank, and take out a time-loan.","45. Space-Based Power System Designers - At some point, the burning of earth's natural resources for power will become a thing of the past. Space-based systems will capture and transmit power far more efficiently than anything currently in existence.","46. Geoengineers - Weather Control Specialists - We are moving past the age of meteorology and climatology to one where the true power-brokers will wield the forces of nature.","47. Plant Educators - An intelligent plant will be capable of re-engineering itself to meet the demands of tomorrow's marketplace. Plant educators will not work with lesson plans or PowerPoint presentations, but the learning process will be even more effective. More details here.","48. Nano-Weapons Specialists - Many of the weapons of the future will be too small to be seen by the human eye. And naturally, these will be the most dangerous. More details here.","49. Lip Designers - If you could have any lips in the world, what would they look like?","50. Mass Energy Storage Developers - As a society, we have become very good at generating electricity, but are still terrible at storing it from one day to the next. Once mass energy storage systems are developed and installed, our total energy needs will drop precipitously.","51. Earthquake Forecasters - Everything we know about the inside of the earth has been developed through indirect evidence. We have no maps of the center of the earth. We have no accurate diagrams, no understanding of motion, fluidity, or changes happening with any degree of accuracy. While scientists are developing skills to work with nanoscale precision on the earth's surface, the best we can muster below the surface is blindfolded guesswork done with 100-mile precision. What we don't know is literally killing us - over 226,000 killed in 2010 alone. But that will change over time as we begin to understand the inner working of the earth and accurately forecast when the next big quakes are about to hit. More details here.","52. Heavy Air Engineers - Compressed air is useful in a wide variety of ways. However, we have yet to figure out how to compress streams of air as they pass through our existing atmosphere. Once we do, it will create untold opportunity for non-surface based housing and transportation system, weather control, and other kinds of experimentation.","53. Robot Polishers - If we are going to have robots, they will invariably need to be polished.","54. Amnesia Surgeons - Doctors who are skilled in removing bad memories or destructive behavior.","55. Executioners for Virus-Builders - In the future, virus-builders who get caught will have a choice. They can either go to the electric chair, or spend some quality time with the Amnesia Surgeon.")>>create antagonist: Rule 1: Demonstrate power Rule 2: Demonstrate motivation Rule 3: Have a character arc Character: 1Sympathetic/empathetic: I.E Their actions should be understandable as why 2Active 3MOtivations 4gRowthHorror types Time and Place Character Details of time and place and character specific to the story What makes a horror a horror? There is the element of Terrror: a feeling of fear and suspense Mystery is what happened before and suspense is what is about to happen Then horror is disgust and shock along with fear Next is grossing out Now coming to horror what are the things that people can be afraid of? Unknown and ++ What is fear? Who does not have any of it? Who does not want anything or has no desire should have no fear. So the fears stem from desires. Desire of what? Desire about the welbeing of some character, or unraveling of mysteries, or justice to be served and desire for the characters to live, to not turn insane, to not be harmed. So the desire in the mind of the reader shall come due to 1. caring about the characters as in a person they would care about like the persons in their life they would care about. 2. If the things are relatable to their world then this will be prohjected to themselves that would make them question their own safety, therefore they would be scared. So, first the characters should be people someone would care about, understand their motivations and maybe somewhat relate and they should also be active, at least in thinking. Maybe they can make choices as well. Then, the world needs to be believable, that means it should be as close to the alternate reality being channeled to you through your thoughts. There can be some what ifs and some degree of mistakes but the world you describe there should be a real one with their dynamics. Also there is this third reason people are scared is that they seek happiness like mouse seek chocolates. If there is a prospect that this happiness is going to be stolen from them, taken from them, they shall be apprehensive about it. From this, comes the element of terror. So about these generalities and thhe fact that we need a character, we can now go to the other factors What is it that people are scared about? There are levels Superficial: Deep: Actual: Character: Fear of heights Fear of death Wants things from life Reader : Superficial:Desires the character to not die Deep: Desires nothing bad happens To the character, happy closure Actual: Happiness Scare is what will take these prospects away, and also Unknown. Existential threat belittles humanity into a sort of cosmic nihilism. The difference from the original that we do not understand appears as a threat too, and therefore the bizzare things are mostly the stuff out of nightmares. If there is a feroucious beast in its natural setting it does not imply as much terror as in suspense if there are stakes on it. Closer it is to the normal world, the more relatable it would be; while more prominent the departure from the normal world of it would be it would be more bizzare and towards uncomfortable territory. Most commonly, if the normal things starts behavioring differently or changes into abonormal things then the abnormal behavior would induce more fear. And then there is the prospect of complete unknown. So what are the things that can behave abnormally? Start from within outwards: THE MIND: The emotions: Suddenly feeling fear or anger The thought logic: I need to jump or kill this man The personalities: He has changed! He is no longer the same. Shining The perceptions: For a moment she saw the houseplant was soaked in blood and then all was fine The unconscious actions: she suddenly looked at the doodles she had made unconsciously and saw she drew a bad face, and a murder scene The conscious actions: By own will or against will that can force someone to do things. He walked towards the danger inspite of not wanting to The memories: He remembered the death of his sister. He was orphan. The motives: The owner of those eyes must be killed The talents: lockpicking into someone's room The flaws: Too curious? You had to come to this room? He said, as Mary laid gazing upon the room full of bloodstains and skeletal remains. The expression of the thoughts, facial expressions.: His facial expression had changed into an odd, unknown emotionless mask while listening to the tale. OR describe a person The soul: Can be exchanged by another. They can be modified : Positively(nicer, radiant)/ Negatively(darker, abusive,rude) Bizzarely, Ominously, Harmfully, Helpfully, Normally, Disfunctionally, Nonfunctionally, Crudely, Pervertedly, Sadistically, Notpresentically,Changically and so on. (notpresentically or absentically means such is absent. Zombies do not have functioning souls attached to them in most instances. Possessed people can have their personalities changed and such. This can be apparent or may not be. They can also have either Qualitative or Quantitative change of an existing component; or they can also have new things or entire new components added to them. THE BODY: The body can change positively(strength) or negatively(weakness and breaking down) or interchangedly(gain of power at heavy cost), As body changes the need for the body can change as well. It may require to have blood, flesh, brains, change into wolves and so on. Bodily functions can change: Old functions qualitatively modded, New fucntions added, Old funtions taken away, Old functions added quantitaively Body anatomy can change Qualitatively Quantitatively Can change as too big or too little of a normal change or a complete new change. Body desires can change: Survival, Air, Drink, Food, Sex THIS CHANGE CAN OCCUR TO ANY CHARACTER: Single, multiple, family, school mates, workplace collegue, travel companions, vacation people, people working in remote places, a whole settlement, a whole district, state level population, country, continent or even planet level can be affected. The affection can be spatially or temporally sporadic, have complete or incomplete penetrance and can have a variable or "all or none" expressivity. If temporally sporadic, any specific time, that repeats or do not repeat over a single day, a week, a time in month such as full moon or specific date of year like halloween or death day or some event day or just when stars are right. The condition can also be actually: reversible with effort, reversible with ease, not reversible, partially reversible. Then there is the environment. Any component of the environment including animals and plants and inanimate objects can be changed Also the climate and weather, the entire terrain, a settlement, a building and so on can be affected Bizzarely, Ominously, Harmfully, Helpfully, Normally, Disfunctionally, Nonfunctionally, Crudely, Pervertedly, Sadistically, Notpresentically,Changically and so on. CAUSE: Cosmic Planetary Lower divine(older gods, babylonian) Otherworld DJinn etc underworld demons Astral world and material plane stuck ones: ghosts Material world beings and those that walk between worolds: Windigo etc Purely material world dwellers in main form: vampires, werewolves Material beings: Chupakabra, Zombies and so on. Also serial killers and insanes. Animals, Plants, Environment, A place, A settlement, A terrain, An event, A group of people that are part of an organization or cult, a group of people that is affected, A Material Object A place A settlement A building of domestic purpose A building of administrative purpose A bulilding of commercial purpose A building of historical purpose An event well known in history An event from past like a murder 20 years back An event not well known in history An ancestry A specific time A specific type of victim A present event A future event AN ACTION Of disrespect Of curse Of revenge Of punishment for coming to that layer so all in all even though it may not be clearly stated in the present time what horror affects, the reason shall always lie in the past unless already told. Roll Maker","Whitesmith","Whitewing","Whittawer","Wigmaker","Willow Plaiter","Winder","Windster","Wire Drawer","Wood Reeve","Woodbreaker","Woodranger","Wool Driver","Wool Grower","Wool Sorter","Wool Winder","Woolcomber","Woolsted Man","Worsted Manufacturer","Wright","Yardman","Yatman","Yearman")>> $colonialeraprofession<</nobr>>What are the components of comedy? What is fun? What is happiness? Happiness is a slower state. TK remember to add the speed of change to the horror one In comedy people are looking for not really happiness but rather fun. What is fun? It is antithesis of seriousness and also dullness or boringness. It is casual and also exciting. If it is just opposite of seriousness it and casualness would be synonymous. But it is not and therefore there should be more to the fun than just against seriousness. It is ANTISERIOUS, and ANTIDULLNESS. Generally something should keep on taking place that is exciting and also is antiserious. There should also be a sense of newness or novelty, except in the case of repeatational comedy or running gag where it becomes funnier as it is repeated again and again till specific point where it reaches its peak. Even there the situation is different. Like a soap seller trying his luck at many places and trying to get the conversation into soaps. He tries to do that while commuting somewhere, in the market, he gets into danger and still tries it, then finally at the kings court he still tries it. Lastly as he is being driven out or getting to be executed he tries to do it with the executionar, when the king interferes and stops it. Then all his soaps are bought. In any case, there should be NOVELTY/NEWNESS Often antiserious is best shown in contrast. The settings should not be anything that has heavy consequences. Like a person screaming in fear of falling from the roof is NOT Fun but a person screaming in fear for falling from the bed is Fun. So, there should not be any threat that is serious. If it does tackle serious issues then it can not tackle it in such a serious manner. Then it becomes a satire And if there are things in it that has serious consequences it becomes a dark humor If it also invokes sadness it becomes a tragicomedy The fun/antiseriousness stands on the base of the theme of the narration. It stems from characters, their relationships, the situation and so on. Comic Timing:Rhythm and Tempo to enhance comedy and humor.Pacing of delivery of joke. Beat: Pause taken for purposes of comic timinh. Allow audience to recognize the joke and react and heighten the suspense before delivery of punchline Slapstick: Physical Comedy with exggerated physical violence: must also let audience know teh hyperbolic nature of the violence and that it exceeds boundaries of commonsense and allows non cruel laughter. That is, such violence, their intent and also the effects are nonserious. Dark humor; intent and effects are not nonserious from the character pov. Pregnant Pause: technique of comic timing to heighten comedic elememt Comedy is doing proposterous things for wrong reasons.Heightened reality. Essence is you need to find the underlying basic joke throughout. If everything is funny, nothing is funny. It should be paced. some comedys job is to point out that it does not make sense(life works taken too seriously) and it does not make all that difference Comedy does noy usually solve problems. It pokes at problems.Comedy is imitation of common errors of life slapstick satire dark humor familial generational comedy Crossdressing and bawdy Class difference Dusguise conflict and resolution: shakespearian comedy Comedy of manners Science of Comedy <<print either("Superiority - comedy that allows you to feel superior as it makes fun of something or someone's shortcomings. Americas funniest video, pranks","Revelation - comedy that reveals a truth that is rarely talked about, in the form of a joke. Like the unprompted truth of a child who breaks an unspoken social practice.","Unexpectedness,Incongruous - comedy where something is said that does not conform with expectations, for instance deliver a punch-line that violates expectations inherent in the setup or contains an unexpected, often sudden, shift in perspective, led astray by incorrect or false expectations.(surprise) unexpected outcome should not be too harmful or serious. It should be nonserious.","Observational - comedy that revolves around making observations about everyday life.","Imitation/exaggeration - perform caricatures where traits of people are exaggerated.(Physical quality: I was so skinny that...., Ability I was so bad at drawing that....,Condition..we were so poor that we ate cereal with fork to save milk...Exaggeration","Repetition: Running gag. Where audience recognition of pattern gains laughs","Inversion","slapstick violence")>> Qualities are: Surprise Sophestication(well thought and intentional) and True With all these observations it can be said that Comedy should have a target to laugh at. It can be someones shortcoming some social practice readers expectations things about everyday life traits of people some situation some lie that is to be covered. someone's action that we know is inappropriate but they dont. Fearing a cat in hat, doing or saying mindlessly things that imitate inappropriate behavior. self hypocracy [[How to write comedy and humor elements]] What is fun? ANTISERIOUS + ANTIDULL/EXCITING + NOVELTY/NEWNESS = HUMOR THERE SHOULD ALSO BE A TARGET. WHAT IS FUNNY? And HOW it is being funny. There should not be any threat that is serious. SERIOUS ISSUE TACKLED in ANTISERIOUS MANNER: SATIRE IF SERIOUS CONSEQUENCES FOR THE CHARACTERS: DARK HUMOR IF SADNESS: TRAGICOMEDY PHYSICAL SATIRE DARK HUMOR SITUATIONAL TARGETED CLASS/IDEAL <<linkreplace "Science of Comedy">> !SCIENCE OF COMEDY !!Superiority - comedy that allows you to feel superior as it makes fun of something or someone's shortcomings. Americas funniest video, pranks","Revelation - comedy that reveals a truth that is rarely talked about, in the form of a joke. Like the unprompted truth of a child who breaks an unspoken social practice.", !!Unexpectedness,Incongruous - comedy where something is said that does not conform with expectations, for instance deliver a punch-line that violates expectations inherent in the setup or contains an unexpected, often sudden, shift in perspective, led astray by incorrect or false expectations.(surprise) unexpected outcome should not be too harmful or serious. It should be nonserious. !!Observational - comedy that revolves around making observations about everyday life. !!Imitation/exaggeration - perform caricatures where traits of people are exaggerated.(Physical quality: I was so skinny that...., Ability I was so bad at drawing that....,Condition..we were so poor that we ate cereal with fork to save milk...Exaggeration","Repetition: Running gag. Where audience recognition of pattern gains laughs !!Inversion !!slapstick violence: Physical Comedy with exggerated physical violence: must also let audience know teh hyperbolic nature of the violence and that it exceeds boundaries of commonsense and allows non cruel laughter. That is, such violence, their intent and also the effects are nonserious. Essential Qualities are: 1.Surprise 2.Sophestication(well thought and intentional, that is it is not a mess) and 3.True <</linkreplace>> With all these observations it can be said that <<button "refresh">><<set $refresh=1>><<script>>state.display(state.active.title, null, "back")<</script>><</button>> !Comedy should have a target to laugh at. !It can be <<print random(1,14)>> !!1. PERSON <<print either("someones shortcoming/FAILS","someone's character trait or mannerism","someones behavior based on the person being a member of some specific population like racist or sexist jokes(note: should be not used or used in positive light")>> !!2.SOCIETY: <<print either("some commonplace social practice seen and shown from an foreign or alien or just a distant perspective to show how odd it looks like an alien describing brushing of teeth","some known social practice that is considered bad by all but still many do, like fapping or pissing outdoors, fart jokes","some accepted but wrong, often serious social norm or law or practice that is pointed out by the satire","some serious issue that has serious consequences pointed out by the intense satire where more idea is to evoke the thought and response than fun, dark social comedy and such")>> !!3. UNEXPECTEDNESS:(Joke is on the reader) readers expectations are not met. They are surprised or Shocked, but in a nonserious and rather harmless way. Like, they are worried about the child and his mother is being followed by a shady tall man that they did not see, and then he also enters their house unseen by them. Then it turns out it is the father who came for a surprise visit and brought them nice things. !!4. WHOLESOME, Subtype of unexpected?: When the unexpectedness is coming with positive revealation about some character that was supposed to be the target of the joke, or target of ridicule but is not so. More like "Awwwww!" Than haha !!5. THINGS ABOUT EVERYDAY LIFE: description of regular workings of the society by 1. A distant/alien/foreign person who tries to describe it without context and misinterpretes things 2. An incomptent person who thinks that it is a great adventure to go to bank. !!6. INCOMPETENCY <<print either("person","population","organization","species","social system")>> To !!!6a. Do what they are supposed to do ]( when a sardar reads newspaper) !!!6b. Do what they have to tackle but dont usually do (when an engineer has to pee..) !!!6c. Cover up a lie and such(BAdly). (the thief said to the judge...) !!!6d. Attempting to present a difficult situation in different way: (The doctor:We are happy to say your gall bladder is free of stones now. Patient: Why I am still in pain? doctor:Your abdomen may still have some of them when we bursted the gall bladder... !!7. SITUATION !!!7a. Between people <<print either("familial","relationship","workplace","transport","at the market","at bar","in a restaurent","church or temple","cemetary","travel","ship","train","anything else you can think of add here")>> !!!7b.People with species !!!7c. People with some problem to tackle: Mountain climbing, Failing business, dealing with love interest, dealing with mother in law !!!7d. Cover up a lie !!!7e. Cover up a situation in a different way, hide bad news, hide good news. !!!7f. Language or other related misunderstanding !!8. HILARIOUSLY UNCONSCIOUS INAPPROPRIATE/SILLY BEHAVIOR: Someone's action that we know is inappropriate but they dont. Fearing a cat in hat, doing or saying mindlessly things that imitate inappropriate behavior. A great scientist describing a theory with a hand gesture that all see and try to not laugh as it looks like jerking off. !!9. HILARIOUSLY CONSCIOUS INAPPROPRIATE/SILLY BEHAVIOR: The great valorous champion did not arrive. Many postulated what great works he must be doing instead of not coming to the competetion. It turns out he ran away and climbed tree as foxes chased him. !!10. SELF HYPOCRISY: The doctor lit his pipe:"Never smoke". "Smoking is the worst" Jerome K Jerome's behavior with the steamers !!11. WORDPLAY: PUNS, KNOCK KNOCK,Shibram Chakrabarty !!12. INHERENTLY FUNNY ACTIVITIES Awkward situations like unwanted/innocent asexual nudity(bean), fart, being gay(in some cultures), poop, pee, snore, sexual reference !!13. SLAPSTICK: Physical violence and bad things in general happens to someone, that is the target is subjected to lot of misfortune or physical or mental abuse; but in a NONSERIOUS/ANTISERIOUS way and WITHOUT any serious consequences, so it is okay to laugh at it. Often the target should also have some trait that justifies such events happening to them, the trait is either they are stupid(Laurel Hardy), or immortal(TOM), or evil (Hitler) !!14. DARK HUMOR: Physical violence and bad things in general happens to someone, that is the target is subjected to lot of misfortune or physical or mental abuse; but in a NONSERIOUS/ANTISERIOUS way and WITH potentially serious consequences, so it is okay to laugh at it. Often the target should also have some trait that justifies such events happening to them, the trait is either they are stupid(Laurel Hardy), or immortal(TOM), or evil (Hitler) Emotion to Elicit <<print either("fear-terror-horror","anger-annoyance-revenge-rage","sadness-grief","joy-optimism","pessimism-cynicism-nihilism","humor-fun","mystery-what already happened in here?","suspense-what is going to happen!?","awe-amazement-wonder","submission-acceptance-trust","lust-eroticism","serenity-disattachment-enlightenment","hatred-disgust","affection","sympathy")>> <<nobr>><<linkreplace "BIG LIST">><<print either("anger","annoyance","rage","aggression","contempt","disgust","boredom","loathing","greif","sadness","pensiveness","remorse","disapproval","amazement","surprise","distraction","awe","terror","fear","apprehension","submission","admiration","trust","acceptance","ectasy","joy","serenity","love","optimism","vigilance","anticipation","interest")>><</linkreplace>> <<linkreplace "middle list">><<print either("grief","disgust","anger","contempt","hate","positive anticipation","optimism","serenity","love","joy","fun and humor","submission","terror","fear","negative apprehension","suspense","awe","surprise","shock")>><</linkreplace>><</nobr>> TARGET <<print either("single","family","group of people for work or situation-vacation-transport-stuck-caught in event","population group, race, cast, gender, nationality","species","event","location","organization")>> THING THAT INTERACTS: <<print either("single char","a family","a group of characters coming together for work, vacation, stuck in event, transport and so on, with or without familial ties","organization","social political cultural religious nature of a population group","natural physical climate weather geographic inorganic nature related","ecological- organic nature related","creature","species","event")>> IT INTERACTS WITH <<print either("single char","a family","a group of characters coming together for work, vacation, stuck in event, transport and so on, with or without familial ties","organization","social political cultural Guard","Crossbowman","Drummer","Guardsman","Halberdier","Knifeman","Knight","Mercenary","Militia","Pikeman","Scout","Sergeant","Sergeant-at-arms","Spearman","Spy","Squire","Viking","Watchman")>> <<elseif $medievalprofession eq "Military-Siege Engineer">> <<print either("Cannoneer","Pioneer -seige","Sapper","Siege Engineer")>> <<elseif $medievalprofession eq "Military-Officer">> <<print either("Admiral","Captain","Captain of the Guard","Marshal")>> <<elseif $medievalprofession eq "Military-Camp Follower">> <<print either("Armorer","Bowyer","Camp Cook","Camp Follower","Cartwright","Fletcher","lancier","linen-armorer","knifesmith","Mercenary","merchant taylor","Pioneer (siege)","poleturner","Prostitute","Sapper","Scout","Siege Engineer","smith","Spy","vaginarius","Weaponsmith")>> <<elseif $medievalprofession eq "Religion">> <<print <<elseif $medievalprofession eq "Service Industry-Parisin 1292">> <<print either("maidservant","Barber-Chirurgeon","restaurateur","water carrier","laundress","porter","doctor","bather profession","copyist")>> <<elseif $medievalprofession eq "Service Industry">> <<print either("accomptant","accoucheur","accoucheus","accountant","actuary","attendent","bagger","bailiff","Barber-Chirurgeon","barrister","Bartender","bath attendent","bather (profession)","Bodyguard","bodyservant","butler","Camp Cook","Camp Follower","carman","carter","cartier","carver","ceiler","cellarer","chamberlain","chimney either("beggar","buffoon","housewife","pilgrim","transient","squatter","urchin","vagabond")>> <<endif>><</nobr>> <<nobr>>COLONIAL ERA PROFESSION: <<set $colonialeraprofession to Cleaner","Student","Stuffgownsman","Sucksmith","Surveyor","Sutler","Swain","Swamper","Sweep","Swineherder","Sword Cutler","Tabler","Tailor","Tallow Chandler","Tally-Clerk","Tallyman","Tankard Bearer","Tanner","Taper Weaver","Tapiser","Tapper","Tapster","Tavern Keeper","Taverner","Tawer","Teamster","Tenter","Thacker","Thatcher","Theologist","Thresher","Throwster","Tickney Man","Tide Spinner","Toller","Tollgate Keeper","Tonsor","Tool Helver","Topman","Topsman","Town Crier","Tradesman","Tramper","Trampler","Tranqueter","Tranter","Traunter","Treen Maker","Treenail Maker","Verrier","Verser","Victualler","Vintager","Vintner","Virginal Player","Vulcan (Profession)","Waferer","Wagoner","Wainwright","Waitman","Wakeman","Walker","Waller","Wantcatcher","Warden","Warder","Warper (Boating)","Warper (Weaving)","Warrener","Washman","Watch Finisher","Watchman","Water Bailiff","Water Carrier","Water Gilder","Water Leader","Waterman","Wattle Hurdle Maker","Way Man","Way-Maker","Weatherspy","Weaver","Webber","Webster","Weeder","Weigher","Well Sinker","Wellmaster","Wellwright","Wet Glover","Wet Nurse","Wetter","Whacker","Whaler","Wharfinger","Wheeler","Wheelwright","Wheeryman","Whipcord Maker","Whipperin","Whit Cooper","White Limer","White Smith","White Tawer","Whitear","Whitener","Whitening Roll Maker","Whitesmith","Whitewing","Whittawer","Wigmaker","Willow Plaiter","Winder","Windster","Wire Drawer","Wood Reeve","Woodbreaker","Woodranger","Wool Driver","Wool Grower","Wool Sorter","Wool Winder","Woolcomber","Woolsted Man","Worsted Manufacturer","Wright","Yardman","Yatman","Yearman")>> $colonialeraprofession<</nobr>> FUTURE OCCUPATIONS EXAMPLES SPECIFIC <<print either( "1. Augmented Reality Architects - Much like the paint we put on houses and the flavorings we add to food, the future will seem boring if our reality hasn't been augmented in some way.","2. Alternative Currency Bankers - According to Javelin Strategies, 20% of all online trades are already being done with alternative currencies. The stage is being set for next-gen alt-currency banks.","3. Seed Capitalists - In the startup business world there is a huge gulf between initial concept and fundable prototypes. This dearth of funding options will require an entirely new profession. Seed capitalists will specialize in high-risk startups. Counter to todays investment-world thinking, if they get more than 100% return on their investments, they will be docked for not taking enough risk.","4. Global System Architects - Our systems are transitioning from national systems into global systems. Architects of these new global systems will play a crucial role in future global politics. More details here.","5. Locationists - People who specialize in adding the relevance of place to our global online communities.","6. Waste Data Managers - To insure data integrity in today's fast evolving information storage industry, multiple redundancies have been built into the system. Achieving more streamline data storage in the future will require de-duplication specialists who can rid our data centers of needless copies and frivolous clutter.","7. Urban Agriculturalists - Why ship food all the way around the world when it can be grown next door. Next generation produce-growing operations will be located underground, often below the grocery stores where the produce will be sold directly to customers. More details here.","8. Business Colony Managers - The average person that turns 30 years old in the U.S. today has worked 11 different jobs. In just 10 years, the average person who turns 30 will have worked 200-300 different projects. Business colonies are an evolving new kind of organizational structure designed around matching talent with pending work projects. The operation will revolve around some combination of resident people based in a physical facility and a non-resident virtual workforce, with some opting to forgo the cost of the physical facility entirely. People who can effectively manage this type of operation will be in high demand. More details here.","9. Competition Producers - One of the hottest new trends will be to design incentive-based competitions to solve some of the world's biggest problems. Paving the way has been X-Prize Foundation's Pete Diamandis and the success of the Ansari X-Prize. In the future, every major corporation will have their name on a major prize competition. Similar to buying the naming rights to a stadium, a well-orchestrated competition has far-reaching branding potential.","10. Avatar Designers - Next generation avatars will become indistinguishable from humans on a two-dimensional screen. However, avatars will only live in the computer world for a short time longer. It is only a matter of time before they emerge from the computer and appear as visual beings, walking around among us. Once an avatar goes through the radical metamorphosis from an image that we see on a screen to a three dimensional being that joins us for dinner, carries on conversations with our friends, and serves as a stand-in for us at meetings, we will see work start on an even more realistic avatar, one that we can touch. More details here.","11. Avatar Relationship Managers - As the foibles of humanity enter the realm of autonomous, freethinking avatars, people will find it necessary to both manage and limit the often dangerous relationships that avatars get themselves into.","12. 3D Printing Engineers - Classes in 3D printing are already being introduced into high schools and the demand for printer-produced products will skyrocket. The trend will be for these worker-less workshops to enter virtually every field of manufacturing, stemming the tide of outsourcing, at the same time, driving the need for competent technicians and engineers to design and maintain the next wave of this technology.","13. 3D Food-Printer Engineers - Pushing the envelope for 3D printer technology even further, will be the coming age of food printers. Converting 3D printers to work with cartridges containing food-stocks will prove difficult and demanding on a number of levels. Those who can solve this kind of problem will be in high demand. More details here.","14. Book-to-App Converters - Over the coming months we will begin to see a form of competition brewing between books and apps. With both being information products that we interface with differently, we will begin to see a large scale effort to convert existing books and literature into an interactive app, similar to the current effort to convert popular literature from print to audiobooks. More details here.","15. Social Education Specialists - We learn from each other. But what is it that we learn from others that is valuable? And how do we structure a circle of friends, as a highly influential group that we rely heavily on, to give us a constant stream of truly valuable information and advice.","16. Privacy Managers - If you think you have lost most of your privacy already, we've only scratched the surface. We are all terminally human, and as such, we do not always make good decisions. Striking the perfect privacy-transparency balance will require far more than amateur insights. It will require a privacy professional. More details here.","17. Wind Turbine Repair Techs - The proliferation of windmills around the world will dramatically drive the demand for repair techs who are not afraid of heights and can solve whatever new problems this fledgling new industry blows their way.","18. Data Hostage Specialists - Holding people as hostages is very messy. But holding data hostage is a less-risky crime that can be done remotely, and has the potential for far greater rewards. This is especially true if the country you're living in condones your actions. This type of activity will give rise to the likes of data-hostage negotiators, data-retrieval specialists, and damage-control analysts.","19. Smart Dust Programmers - In it's simplest form, smart dust consists of a sensor combined with a wireless transmitter and some kind of power source. Many are envisioning the power to come from wireless RF signals. The reason it is referred to as smart dust is because the technology is shrinking in size until it reaches the particle size of dust. Future designs for smart dust involve detecting everything from moisture content, to soil temperature, to chemical composition. More details here.","20. Personality Services - Talking back and forth to a computer that has a machine-like voice is boring. But being able to download specific personality packages will add an entirely new level of engagement for basement-dwellers everywhere. The hottest personalities to download will be offshoots of existing characters or celebrities such as being able to download a David Letterman personality, a Homer Simpson personality, or perhaps even a Darth Vader personality.","21. Smart Contact Developers - The idea of smart contact lenses, the kind that can superimpose information on the wearer's field of view has been around for a while. But the first iteration of smart contact lenses is already on the market and industry execs are beginning to generate a wide array of possible applications. More details here.","22. Nano-Medics - The medical problems most people have can be traced to a single cell or a small group of them. Health professionals capable of working on the nano-level, both in designing diagnostics systems, remedies, and monitoring solutions will be in high demand.","23. New Science Philosopher-Ethicists - Every new technology creates its own set of unintended consequences, and people who can ask the tough questions and demand deeper introspection will be in high demand. Industry sages will serve as both a conscience and a guide for decision-makers everywhere.","24. Organ Agents - The demand for transplantable organs is exploding and people who can track down and deliver healthy organs will be in hot demand.","25. Octogenarian Service Providers - As the population continues the age we will have record numbers of people living into their 80s, 90s, and 100s. This mushrooming group of active oldsters will provide a demand for goods and services currently not being addressed in today's marketplace.","26. Elevated Tube Transport Engineers - The next big infrastructure project on planet earth will be a human and cargo transport system designed around a network of vacuum tubes with maglev tracks. Operating at less than 2% of the cost of today's car, truck, jet, ship, and train systems, this emerging tube transport system will be a massive undertaking that demands talented new-age thinkers for decades to come. More details here.","The Dismantlers: Over the coming years will see a number of industries dismantled requiring a skilled workforce of talented people who can perform this task in the least disruptive way. Most of these industries have been built around aging facilities and infrastructure that will become unnecessary and unsustainable in the future. These will include:","27. Prison System Dismantlers - More details here.","28. Hospital and Healthcare Dismantlers - More details here.","29. Income Tax System Dismantlers - More details here and here.","30. Government Agency Dismantlers - More details here.","31. Education System Dismantlers - More details here and here and here.","32. College and University Dismantlers - More details here and here and here.","33. Drone Dispatchers - Drones will be used to deliver groceries and pizzas, deliver water, remove trash and sewage, monitor traffic and pollution, and change out the batteries on our homes. Skilled dispatchers for future drones will be high demand. More details here.","34. Brain Quants - Where the stock market manipulators of the past meet the brain manipulators of the future to usurp control of Madison Avenue.","35. Tree-Jackers - Plant and tree alteration specialists, who manipulate growth patterns, create grow-to-fit wood products, color-changing leaves, and personalized fruit. More details here.","36. Plant Psychologists - An entire profession dedicated to undo the damage caused by the Tree-Jackers","37. Extinction Revivalists - People who revive extinct animals.","38. Robotic Earthworm Drivers - The most valuable land on the planet will soon be the landfills because that is where we have buried our most valuable natural resources. In the future, robotic earthworms will be used to silently mine the landfills and replace whatever is extracted with high-grade soil.","39. Gravity Pullers - The first wave of people to unlock the code for influencing gravity.","40. Time Hackers - If we think cyber terrorists are a pain, it will seem like nothing compared to devious jerry-riggers who start manipulating the time fabric of our lives.","41. Clone Ranchers - Raising blank humans will be similar in many respects to cattle ranching. But once a clone is selected, and the personality download is complete, the former clone will instantly be elevated to human status.","42. Body Part & Limb Makers - The Organ Agents listed above will quickly find themselves out of work as soon as we figure out how to efficiently grow and mass produce our own organs from scratch.","43. Memory Augmentation Therapists - Entertainment is all about the great memories it creates. Creating a better grade of memories can dramatically change who we are and pave the way for an entirely new class of humans.","44. Time Brokers - Time Bank Traders - Where do you go when you run out of time? Naturally, to the time-bank, and take out a time-loan.","45. Space-Based Power System Designers - At some point, the burning of earth's natural resources for power will become a thing of the past. Space-based systems will capture and transmit power far more efficiently than anything currently in existence.","46. Geoengineers - Weather Control Specialists - We are moving past the age of meteorology and climatology to one where the true power-brokers will wield the forces of nature.","47. Plant Educators - An intelligent plant will be capable of re-engineering itself to meet the demands of tomorrow's marketplace. Plant educators will not work with lesson plans or PowerPoint presentations, but the learning process will be even more effective. More details here.","48. Nano-Weapons Specialists - Many of the weapons of the future will be too small to be seen by the human eye. And naturally, these will be the most dangerous. More details here.","49. Lip Designers - If you could have any lips in the world, what would they look like?","50. Mass Energy Storage Developers - As a society, we have become very good at generating electricity, but are still terrible at storing it from one day to the next. Once mass energy storage systems are developed and installed, our total energy needs will drop precipitously.","51. Earthquake Forecasters - Everything we know about the inside of the earth has been developed through indirect evidence. We have no maps of the center of the earth. We have no accurate diagrams, no understanding of motion, fluidity, or changes happening with any degree of accuracy. While scientists are developing skills to work with nanoscale precision on the earth's surface, the best we can muster below the surface is blindfolded guesswork done with 100-mile precision. What we don't know is literally killing us - over 226,000 killed in 2010 alone. But that will change over time as we begin to understand the inner working of the earth and accurately forecast when the next big quakes are about to hit. More details here.","52. Heavy Air Engineers - Compressed air is useful in a wide variety of ways. However, we have yet to figure out how to compress streams of air as they pass through our existing atmosphere. Once we do, it will create untold opportunity for non-surface based housing and transportation system, weather control, and other kinds of experimentation.","53. Robot Polishers - If we are going to have robots, they will invariably need to be polished.","54. Amnesia Surgeons - Doctors who are skilled in removing bad memories or destructive behavior.","55. Executioners for Virus-Builders - In the future, virus-builders who get caught will have a choice. They can either go to the electric chair, or spend some quality time with the Amnesia Surgeon.")>>Temparature<<print either("too cold","mesothermal","too hot")>> Gaseous Content: Air Oxygen either("person","thing","organization","place","event","machine","document","information","parent","sibling","offspring","spouse","love interest","would be love interest","distant relative","parent in law","sibling in law","soldier","mythological being","patient","single creature","country","planet","friend","collegue","comrade","offspring in law","enemy","animal","king/queen","prince/princess","elected official","hired/selected official","CEO","Admin","White collar worker","Blue collar worker","Lower class worker","Creative worker","Scholar, wizard, scribe, researcher","political person","rebel","fighter","love interest","parent","step parent","sibling","in law","son","daughter")>> !!MOTIVATION <<print either("survival","basic","physical","psychological","spiritual","insanity")>> Survival:Something threatens the life of the entity in question, and escaping the danger is the motivation Basic: Something that is necessary for life sustainance is to be met. Meeting that necessity is basic motivation: Food, Drink, Warmth, Oxygen, Power(mecha), Blood(vampire), Medicine(life saving medicine dependent patient) Physical(Something that is seeked on the physcal scale for the continuation and betterment of life but is not essential for the bare survival) money, sex, greed, entertainment, profit Psychological: Something that is psychological like esteem, proving onse worth, honor etc Spiritual: Finding deeper meaning, purpose Insanity: Quirked cause and effect and logic, includes antisurvival and such without definite cause etc. The motivation is for/towards <<print either("self","other single person","other single person : enemy","multiple person","a race","a species","family","own kind")>> <<button "refresh">><<set $refresh=1>><<script>>state.display(state.active.title, null, "back")<</script>><</button>>
